pkgmetadata.longdescription: Flexible Phenotype Simulation from Different Genetic and Noise Models // Phenotype simulator allows for the flexible simulation of phenotypes under different models, including fixed and background genetic effects as well as correlated, fixed and background noise effects. Different phenotypic effects can be combined into a final phenotype while controling for the proportion of variance explained by each of the components. For each component, the number of variables, their distribution and the design of their effect across traits can be customised. The final simulated phenotypes and its components can be automatically saved into .rds or .csv files. In addition, for simulated genotypes, export into plink format is possible.
